A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
As I readied myself to watch the new installment in the Star Wars franchise the same awe and wonder began to set in as the first time I watched "A New Hope."  ...ill give it to Rian Johnson despite the shitty Marvel humor that took away from potentialy important scenes the opening segment of the First Order dreadnaught being bombed was pretty great. Unfortunately the entire movie felt like a big F@$k you to fans. Tje Last Jedi continued after the Force Awakensbut not much more then that it completely made existing plots from previous films irrelevant... seriously? 

C'mon I get it. The Skywalker story has to end old story lines cant go forever and this movie did a great job telling us that over and over again. 

But really? Luke milking a mamal like creature while awkwardly starring at the camera? Really? 

Cant wait for the next film. Star wars and the quest for more money.
